title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

10:17 <+mflorea> tmortagne: I don't understand your last commit on xwiki-platform  
10:18 <+tmortagne> mflorea: it's not real modification it's because i did a comitt on my repo before pulling  
10:18 <+mflorea> ok  
10:19 <+tmortagne> I actually forgot that i did not pushed yesterday  
10:19 <+tmortagne> that's the thing with committed stuff not on repo it's not obvious in Eclipse anymore  
10:20 <+mflorea> :)  
10:20 <+mflorea> I see watchlist is failing on ci but I can build locally  
10:24 <+tmortagne> mflorea: yea I need to look at that i don't know why it's failing on jenkins  
10:25 <+tmortagne> ha no  
10:25 <+tmortagne> you are not talking about tests ?  
10:25 <+tmortagne> that's the push i forgot yesterday  
10:25 <+tmortagne> you probably just pulled  
10:25 <+tmortagne> should be ok on jenkins now  
10:25 <+mflorea> no, there is compilation failure on watchlist api  
10:26 <+tmortagne> yes that's fixed  
10:26 <+tmortagne> platform is building right now  
10:26 <+tmortagne> it's only on maven 2  
10:26 <+mflorea> great  
10:26 <+tmortagne> looks like it has some bug with runtime dependencies handling  
10:26 <+mflorea> XWiki.Soares111 spams us  
10:27 <+mflorea> spam comments  
10:27 <+mflorea> how can I block this user?  
10:27 <+tmortagne> there is an active/unactive proparty in user object but I'm not sure it's working properly anymore  
10:28 <+tmortagne> s/proparty/property/  
10:30 <+sburjan> mflorea: I think you can remove his user if he's not gonna stop  
10:31 <+mflorea> let's see if he makes any more changes  
10:32 <+sburjan> removed or blocked user ?  
10:33 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:34 <+mflorea> I made it inactive  
11:04 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:14 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: You should do  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> git pull --rebase  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> instead of git pull  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> Since a simple pull creates a useless merge commit  
11:41 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep I forgot and did the pull from Eclipse (which does not really get parameters...)  
11:41 <@sdumitriu> Oh, OK  
11:41 <@sdumitriu> I should try the eclipse client at some point  
11:42 <+tmortagne> works well for simple tasks but i can't make Team sync perspective to work  
11:43 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I think you can configure that manually in .git/config  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> So it doesn't require the parameter  
11:44 <+tmortagne> you mean use --rebase by default ?  
11:44 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
11:44 <+tmortagne> ok cool, looking  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> branch.<name>.rebase  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> And branch.autosetuprebase  
11:46 <@sdumitriu> branch.autosetuprebase=true should be set in the global config  
11:47 <+tmortagne> ok thanks  
11:53 <+tmortagne> xwiki-platform is now stable on jenkins  
11:53 <@cjdelisle> is there a magic word to pull all of the repos at once? I know I asked this before and got told to RTFM but then there was a bunch of reorganizing and I lost the link to TFM.  
11:54 <+tmortagne> fixing enterprise and manager now  
12:01 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
12:19 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
12:33 <@sdumitriu> cjdelisle: xwiki-trunks  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> But then you need to do git submoude update --init --recursive  
12:34 <@sdumitriu> But then you need to do git submodule update --init --recursive  
12:45 <abusenius> has quit  
12:48 <chanikag> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <sdumitriu> has quit  
13:20 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
13:26 <@cjdelisle> Why is Invitation part of platform? It seems to me that it should be above platform in the applications section. It is certainly not required to build the platform.  
13:26 <@sdumitriu> There's no applications section anymore  
13:27 <+tmortagne> cjdelisle: everything is platform/commons/rendering now the only thing above is distributions (enterprise/manager)  
13:34 <mflorea> has quit  
13:35 <@cjdelisle> There may not be an xwiki-applications directory anymore but I don't think it's right for extensions to be labeled as part of the platform.  
13:37 <@sdumitriu> Fight with vmassol  
13:37 <@cjdelisle> hehe \*debate  
13:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: is svn synchronized with git? I'm going to merge a change in 3.0 and 2.7 using git and I hope the change will be visible on svn also  
13:39 <@sdumitriu> No, there's no synchronization  
13:39 <@sdumitriu> SVN is mostly read only at the moment  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> I'll have to move back the committers groups  
13:40 <@sdumitriu> But there was a vote saying that for 3.0 and 2.7 only SVN is used  
13:43 <+mflorea> "only"?  
13:43 <+mflorea> I already committed changed to the 3.0 and 2.7 git branches  
13:44 <+mflorea> I don't agree with "only".  
13:44 <@sdumitriu> I did commits there too  
13:45 <@sdumitriu> Let me find the vote  
13:45 <+mflorea> I know the mail  
13:45 <+mflorea> but I understood it as "be able to"  
13:45 <+mflorea> not "use only svn"  
13:46 <@sdumitriu> http://markmail.org/thread/jqr2ghhunxphfhvw  
13:46 <+mflorea> otherwise we need to apply what we committed already to svn and remove the 3.0 and 2.7 branches from git  
13:47 <+mflorea> but I prefer to use a single tool  
13:47 <+mflorea> and if git was chosen, then that tool is git  
13:47 <ihalip> sdumitriu: how's the student ranking going?  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> Me too, but it's a bit hard at the moment  
13:48 <@sdumitriu> ihalip: Pretty OK, we've gone through all the proposals with an initial good/crap filter  
13:49 <ihalip> crap filter :)  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Where would you like to merge? WYSIWYG?  
13:49 <+mflorea> yes  
13:52 <@sdumitriu> OK, go with git  
13:52 <@sdumitriu> Or wait  
13:52 <@sdumitriu> There's no wysiwyg directory on the branch, right?  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> Let me check  
13:53 <+mflorea> the layout is different  
13:54 <Avipar> has joined #xwiki  
13:57 <mflorea> has quit  
14:06 <arkub> has quit  
14:20 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: still got https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/198dedd30b0edb71856d4c38857e26cd66168831 with branch.autosetuprebase=always  
14:20 <@sdumitriu> That affects future branches  
14:20 <+tmortagne> ho  
14:20 <@sdumitriu> it's \*setup\*  
14:21 <+tmortagne> so I have to force it too for the current branch ?  
14:21 <@sdumitriu> You should use the other option, branch.<name>.rebase  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> autosetuprebase does that automatically for new branches, but for existing ones you have to add it manually  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> So, you should edit .git/config  
14:22 <+tmortagne> ok  
14:22 <@sdumitriu> Find the [branch "master"] section  
14:23 <@sdumitriu> And add:  
14:23 <@sdumitriu> rebase = true  
14:25 <+tmortagne> done, thanks  
14:26 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: So the build is almost working now? What's left, manager?  
14:27 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: actually i refactored even manager, waiting now to see what I forgotten  
14:27 <@sdumitriu> How did you solve the problem with the platform tools?  
14:28 <+tmortagne> by a hack for now: I created a job for xar handlers alone on jenkins  
14:29 <+tmortagne> finish with the rest and I get back to it  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> That only fixes hudson  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> But I don't think it will work during releases  
14:29 <+tmortagne> yes I know  
14:29 <@sdumitriu> Actually it could  
14:29 <+tmortagne> which is why i said i will get back to it  
14:30 <@sdumitriu> It will throw an error during the first build, then the releaser has to do a manual build on tools, then restart the release  
14:31 <+tmortagne> no need to buil all tools  
14:31 <+tmortagne> xar handler is enough  
14:31 <+tmortagne> but it's not what i call a normal release having to do that  
14:32 <+tmortagne> problem is that as far as i can see that's a maven bug (impossible to build and use an extension in the same build)  
14:34 <+tmortagne> not sure what is the worst between the pre build by hand hack during releases and putting xar-handlers in its own repository if we can't find a clean solution  
14:40 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
14:42 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <mbryant> Good morning all I have a conceptual question: My Process is that I am currently trying to extend the wysiwyg editor to include ozone widgets.  I know that I can add buttons and what not, as well using macros to control the ozen interface, my question is, that i would like to be able to have the widget live (meaning I can edit it and use it not just a static block, like with macros).  
14:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <mbryant> 1) is this possible and 2) if it is possible where inside of the editor, if even in the editor should I start looking.. from an archtectual standpoint  
14:52 <Avipar> has left #xwiki  
14:55 <+tmortagne> I commit but I constantly forget to push stuff...  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: You'll get used to it  
15:01 <+tmortagne> yea i guess  
15:01 <@sdumitriu> mbryant: mflorea can help you  
15:02 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: "Good morning all I have a conceptual question: My Process is that I am currently trying to extend the wysiwyg editor to include ozone widgets.  I know that I can add buttons and what not, as well using macros to control the ozen interface, my question is, that i would like to be able to have the widget live (meaning I can edit it and use it not just a static block, like with macros)."  
15:02 <mbryant> sdumitriu: thanks  
15:07 <+mflorea> mbryant: first thing you should know is that the content is stored in wiki syntax and whatever you do must be storable in wiki syntax. How do you plan to store the ozone widgets in the content?  
15:08 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: I think you can remove tools repositories from github now  
15:08 <@sdumitriu> K  
15:09 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Do you want admin rights?  
15:09 <mbryant> mflorea: the plan at least at first was to wrap it into a macro, whcih would store the paramaters used for that particular instance of the ozone widget.  The macro would reach out and touch another webservice to retraive the data specific to that instance.  
15:09 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: sure, does that mean "please do the remove" ? :D  
15:09 <mbryant> it seemed like the path of least restance at that point.. but I am not sure that it is the best way  
15:10 <+mflorea> mbryant: are you using XE 3.0?  
15:10 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Added, I'm doing the remove  
15:11 <+tmortagne> ok thanks  
15:11 <mbryant> mflorea: currently we baselined on 2.7, but we can make the shift if it provides better soulution, or streamlined  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: One thing we don't have is xem-web-debug-eclipse  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> What do you want to do with it?  
15:14 <@sdumitriu> I have it locally in a repo, if you're interested  
15:15 <+tmortagne> it's in platform AFAIK  
15:15 <+mflorea> In 2.7 a button HTML element is used to protect the macro output, while in 3.0 a CSS class determines the behavior. One option would be to write a editor plugin (easier in 3.0 since the plugin api was moved in a separate maven module) that detects the macros that wrap ozone widgets and overwrites the macro behavior. But I'm not sure what you mean by "live", editing in place? Note that in this case you would be editing the output so you need a   
15:15 <+tmortagne> but it would probably make more sense in its own repository i guess  
15:16 <+tmortagne> (since it's not supposed to be built it's not very clean as platform submodule)  
15:17 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: WDYT ?  
15:17 <@sdumitriu> I don't think it is in platform at the moment  
15:17 <+tmortagne> well i can see it :)  
15:17 <@sdumitriu> It's not anywhere, except on my computer  
15:17 <@sdumitriu> Where?  
15:17 <+tmortagne> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xem-web-debug-eclipse  
15:18 <@sdumitriu> Oh, right  
15:18 <@sdumitriu> :D  
15:18 <+tmortagne> :)  
15:18 <+tmortagne> my +1 for alone in it's own repository on https://github.com/xwiki/  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> +1  
15:19 <+mflorea> mbryant: currently the source is saved in an XML comment. So when you edit a macro the XML comment is updated. This body of this XML comment has a specific syntax. If you want to edit live then there are two cases: (1) the client knows how to update the UI --> in this case you have to update the XML comment before the save action. (2) the client doesn't know how to update the content, so it needs to make requests to the server. In this case yo  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Write shorter messages, both were cut off  
15:19 <+tmortagne> and maybe latter there would be other like this one for other IDE maybe  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> "Note that in this case you would be editing the output so you need a "  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> "In this case yo"  
15:19 <+mflorea> what?  
15:19 <+mflorea> :|  
15:19 <@sdumitriu> IRC has a maximum message length  
15:20 <+mflorea> where this max length specified?  
15:20 <mbryant> thanks I was just about to say that.. :/  
15:20 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: are you taking care of creating the repository ? (then I will reafactor it with proper git links)  
15:20 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: K  
15:20 <+sburjan> mflorea: afaik 512 chars  
15:20 <+mflorea> my client doesn't complain  
15:22 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: What should it be called? xem-web-debug-eclipse?  
15:22 <+mflorea> mbryant: currently the source is saved in an XML comment. So when you edit a macro the XML comment is updated. This body of this XML comment has a specific syntax. If you want to edit live then there are two cases:  
15:22 <+mflorea> (1) the client knows how to update the UI --> in this case you have to update the XML comment before the save action. (2) the client doesn't know how to update the content, so it needs to make requests to the server. In this case you need to update the XML for each request.  
15:23 <+mflorea> In 2.7 a button HTML element is used to protect the macro output, while in 3.0 a CSS class determines the behavior. One option would be to write a editor plugin (easier in 3.0 since the plugin api was moved in a separate maven module)  
15:23 <+mflorea> that detects the macros that wrap ozone widgets and overwrites the macro behavior. But I'm not sure what you mean by "live", editing in place? Note that in this case you would be editing the output so you need a way to update the source from the modified output.  
15:24 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: How about xwiki-debug-eclipse or xwiki-eclipse-debug  
15:24 <+mflorea> read the last 2 messages and then the first 2  
15:25 <@sdumitriu> Since XEM is kind of the topmost project, and the others (watch, workspaces) are almost dead, it doesn't make sense to specify xem in the name  
15:26 <mbryant> mflorea: okay, I am following so far, since the 3.0 seems like a better decoupled solution.  to place an ozone widget, that only is editable at page render.  Where is the editor plugin, and is it a gwt, or are you referenceing this site : http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module  
15:27 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Pushed to https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-debug-eclipse  
15:28 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep xwiki-debug-eclipse is fine  
15:28 <+mflorea> mbryant: wdym by "editable at page render"?  
15:29 <mbryant> mflorea: so if I have a map ozone widget, the ozone widget is interactble at page render.. and we were thinking about storing the content of that widget (the data set used to produce that instance) in another store, though we have not decided on a solution for that yet  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: I think the repositories are almost final (except the debug and the xarhandler)  
15:29 <@sdumitriu> WDYT?  
15:30 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: yep, looks good  
15:30 <@sdumitriu> Can we go on and update http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository ?  
15:30 <+tmortagne> +1  
15:30 <+mflorea> mbryant: page render = when you view the page or when you edit the page, or both?  
15:31 <mbryant> mflorea: view.  But the ultimate goal if we can pull it off is also at edit.  
15:31 <@sdumitriu> Actually I'd rather take care of GSoC today, I wonder if someone else can update that...  
15:31 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: finishing with xwiki-debug-eclipse and I'm looking at it  
15:34 <sburjan`> has quit  
15:34 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
15:36 <+tmortagne> sdumitriu: hmm there is still contrib stuff to put on github, isn't it ?  
15:36 <+tmortagne> but in another organisation  
15:38 <@cjdelisle> Anything I wrote that's in contrib can be put in /dev/null, If I want to play with it I'll get it from history and put it in my namespace.  
15:38 <+mflorea> mbryant: it depends if the user interaction produces changes inside XWiki (e.g. page content is changed or some xobjects are updated) or not. If the state of the ozone widget is stored outside XWiki then simply writing a macro for XE 3.0 should be enough, because in 3.0 you can interact with macro output. If the state is stored inside XWiki then it's tricky to do it in view mode.  
15:38 <+mflorea> In edit mode you can write a plugin for the wysiwyg editor that listens to the user interaction and updates the macro source (the XML metadata comment)  
15:40 <mbryant> mflorea: so it really comes down to its wasy to do one or the other but not both?  while I am not a fan of duplicating content in mulitple places, could their be a routine that while in edit mode, you build the lets call it a record set, to push out to the external location that controls that specific page on view  
15:45 <sburjan> has quit  
15:45 <+mflorea> mbryant: you could, checkout the editor code and look at the existing plugins (git: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/tree/xwiki-web-3.0/xwiki-platform-web svn: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/web/tags/xwiki-web-3.0/ )  
15:48 <mbryant> mflorea: thanks for the point to the code, which are the existing plugins, and do I have to extend, or simply implement the plugin api  
15:51 <+mflorea> you can either implement an interface or extends one of the helper classes. You can find existing plugin in wysiwyg-client module. Note that plugin are not picked automatically, so you have to "register" their class in WysiwygEditorFactory class. Check the existing plugins and you'll see  
15:52 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Do you remember where is the document describing standard classnames, like withTip and suggestDocuments?  
15:53 <@sdumitriu> evalica: Found it, nevermind  
15:55 <mbryant> mflorea: okay I am going to arvhive this and poke around a bit thanks for your help, and I am sure I will be poking you sooner or later in the near future.. again thank you for your help .  Side question, I know you used GWT to help build this, do I need anything specific to build an extension, eg have GWT, and do anything special?  
15:57 <+mflorea> you just need java and maven. See http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
15:57 <+mflorea> you're welcome ;)  
16:18 <jvdrean> has quit  
16:22 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
16:38 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
16:48 <@sdumitriu> tmortagne: Are you working on xwiki-debug-eclipse?  
16:48 <+tmortagne> yep  
16:49 <+tmortagne> (plus keeping an eye on jenkins for platform/enterprise/manager)  
16:50 <@sdumitriu> How do you plan to do it?  
16:51 <@sdumitriu> I was thinking that one way would be to add it as a submodule to xwiki-trunks, and then add symlinks to files/directories in the other submodules of trunks  
16:52 <+tmortagne> adding it to xwiki-trunks yes but I would prefer links to real repositories for files and folder of xwiki-debug-eclipse itself  
16:52 <+tmortagne> hmm  
16:53 <+tmortagne> I don't want it to work only if you clone trunks  
16:53 <jamesxu> has quit  
16:53 <+tmortagne> but then the issue is what repository access to choose for the links (ssh, https...)  
16:57 <+tmortagne> or if we do that we put it in trunks directly and not in its own repository  
16:57 <+tmortagne> would allow to use relative links  
17:02 <+tmortagne> but anyway trunks has the same issue itself  
17:02 <npm> has quit  
17:14 <+tmortagne> git submodules seems very complex to use compared to svn externals
